summary: This bill, the National Concussion and Traumatic Brain Injury Clearinghouse Act of 2025, mandates the establishment of a national clearinghouse. This clearinghouse will disseminate vetted information on concussion, traumatic brain injury, and related health issues. The clearinghouse is intended for medical professionals, patients, and other stakeholders, providing access to best practices, medical knowledge, and resources. The Secretary of Health and Human Services, Director of the CDC, and Secretary of Labor will jointly designate a Federal official to oversee the clearinghouse, with a built-in default designation if no agreement is reached. The clearinghouse should be operational within 120 days of the act's passing.
